CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Akmal, 2704 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes are giving sufficient financial help to the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People?" Answer reads: "I really can't tell because I don't know the financial situation of the NAACP. However, I'm certain that it requires a lot of money to do what they are trying to do."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Akmal wearing jeweled brooch with clock face, standing between store windows displaying female mannequin with fur stole, and shoes
